wikipedia_page.main: Alec Dockar (first ¼ 1920 – 1994) was an English professional rugby league footballer who played in the 1930s, 1940s and 1950s. He played at representative level for Great Britain and England, and at club level for Hull Kingston Rovers (Heritage №) and Hull F.C. (Heritage №) (World War II guest), as a scrum cap-wearing loose forward, i.e. number 13, during the era of contested scrums.

link_mentions.page: List of Great Britain national rugby league team players

response: Born in New Plymouth, New Zealand, Dockar-Clay is of Māori descent (from the Ngāti Porou and Te Āti Awa iwi). He is the great-grandson of Great Britain and England rugby league representative Alec Dockar.
